snippet: This is not the Next Big One, a pandemic destined to circle the world, as some anxious observers might think.
abstract: Op-Ed article by author David Quammen holds that Ebola virus, which has received much public attention since deadly outbreak in Guinea, is unlikely to become next global scourge; says disease, while virulent and frightening in pockets of people it affects, afflicts mainly poor African people obliged by scarcity to scavenge dead animals for food; calls for continued research into disease and help for those affected by it.
lead_paragraph: This is not the Next Big One, a pandemic destined to circle the world, as some anxious observers might think.

headline.main: Ebola Virus: A Grim, African Reality
headline.print_headline: Ebola Is Not the Next Pandemic
